isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: TRW/ROSS-TAS 40, 55, 65 AND 85 - ASSEMBLE - POPPET COMPONENT

step1.para: If the poppet assemblies are to be removed for replacement, place the rack piston in a soft-jawed vise ( Figure 89).

Slide special tool 4402-1 over the seat of the poppet adjuster seat and sleeve assembly and engage the tool in the slots in the threaded sleeve. Hit the end of the tool firmly four or five times with a 2-lb. sledge hammer to loosen the Loctite ( Figure 90).

note.para: Poppet adjuster seat and sleeve assemblies are retained by Loctite applied to the threads which makes the assemblies difficult to remove.

step1.para: With a ratchet applied to the tool, turn one adjuster seat and sleeve assembly out of the rack piston. If the ratchet does not turn easily, strike the adjuster removal tool again with a hammer. If the engaging tangs won't stay in place while tightening, it might be necessary to hold in place with an arbor press while applying loosening force ( Figure 91). Discard poppet seat and sleeve assembly.
Remove the two poppets, spring, spacer rod and push tube ( Figure 92).
Remove and discard the remaining poppet seat and sleeve assembly only if required ( Figure 93).

figure.caption: Figure 93. Remove and Discard Remaining Poppet Seat

note.para: It is possible to reset one poppet adjuster seat and sleeve assembly for automatic poppet adjustment while it is in the rack piston if one adjuster seat and sleeve assembly and the poppets, spring, spacer rod and push tube are removed.

step1.para: If one poppet seat and sleeve assembly was left in the rack piston, it can be reset for automatic poppet adjustment by inserting a 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) diameter x 6 inch (152.4 mm) drill rod down through the poppet seat hole at the opposite end of the rack piston and against the adjuster seat to press the seat in until it bottoms against the adjuster sleeve ( Figure 94).

figure.caption: Figure 94. Reset For Automatic Poppet Adjustment

step1.para: Carefully apply Loctite Primer "T" to the threads in the poppet holes and threads on the new seat and sleeve assemblies. Allow to dry for ten minutes, then carefully apply Loctite 680 to the same threads ( Figure 95).

caution.para: Do not allow Loctite 680 to get on the adjuster seat component of the adjuster seat and sleeve assembly. The poppets will not function properly.

warning.para: Wear eye protection while assembling poppets, as spring loaded poppets could eject and cause eye injury.

step1.para: Place rack piston in a soft-jawed vise and turn one new poppet adjuster seat and sleeve assembly (slotted end out) into the poppet hole in one end of the rack piston ( Figure 96).
From the other end of the poppet hole in the rack piston, install: one poppet, poppet spring, nylon spacer rod, push tube, other poppet and the other new poppet adjuster seat and sleeve assembly.
Tighten both poppet seat and sleeve assemblies to 18 ft-lbs. (25 N•m).
